Statements regarding potential future development plans for Gencaro, including Phase 3 clinical trials.
The Board of Directors established a Special Committee to evaluate strategic options including merger, sale, or other transactions.

Actual results could differ materially from those projected in the forward-looking statements.
The Board has no defined timeline for the strategic review process.
Gencaro is developed for patients with chronic heart failure and targeted based on genotype.
Implemented anti-takeover provisions to discourage or delay acquisitions, requiring stockholder actions to be conducted at meetings and making it difficult for third parties to acquire the company.

1. Classified board of directors; 2. Authority to issue 5 million additional shares of preferred stock; 3. Limits on calling special meetings; 4. Prohibition of stockholder action by written consent; 5. Advance notice requirements for board nominations.
Could discourage potential acquisition proposals, delay change in control, and reduce vulnerability to unsolicited acquisition proposals.
Subject to Delaware anti-takeover laws preventing mergers with stockholders owning 15% or more in the first three years without board approval.
Issuing preferred stock could adversely affect common stockholder rights and may dilute their holdings.

elements.title: Development of Gencaro and rNAPc2 for treating HF and COVID-19

data.value: Major unmet medical need for patients with HF and AF, particularly for those with EF values of 40% and above.
Current therapies for patients with EF ≥ 40% are limited and have significant side effects.
Gencaro may offer a safer and more effective therapy for treating AF in higher ejection fraction HF patients.
International patent portfolio, including new chemical entity status, potentially extending to 2039 in the US.
Laboratory platform approved by FDA for use in Phase 2B clinical trial.
Initiated Phase 2b clinical trial for rNAPc2 in COVID-19 patients, completed enrollment in Q4 2021.
Additional financing required to support continued development of Gencaro and rNAPc2.
Pursuing co-development and commercialization partnerships with large pharmaceutical companies.
Risk of inability to obtain sufficient financing or complete strategic transactions, leading to potential discontinuation of development.

elements.title: Leadership Changes and Current Board Members

data.value: Mr. Dekker - President, Vice President of Finance, and Senior Director, Finance and Controller; Dr. Grais - Board member since May 2007; Dr. Woosley - Appointed July 2013; Mr. Conway - Chairman since 2014; Mr. Mitchell - Appointed February 2014.

Mr. Dekker - Leadership roles in finance and accounting; Dr. Grais - Experience in biopharmaceuticals and law; Dr. Woosley - Expertise in pharmacology; Mr. Conway - CEO experience in biopharma; Mr. Mitchell - Venture capital focus.
Mr. Dekker - B.S. in accounting; Dr. Grais - B.A., M.D., J.D.; Dr. Woosley - Ph.D. in Pharmacology, M.D.; Mr. Conway - B.S. in accounting; Mr. Mitchell - B.S., M.B.A.
Member of the Board since February 2017, manager of Acorn Bioventures, former general partner at Venrock Associates, and CEO of Bellevue Asset Management.
Appointed in June 2022, Managing Member of Cable Car Capital LLC, experience in healthcare investment analysis.
Appointed in December 2022, Managing Member of Nerium Capital LLC, experience in healthcare investment, former analyst at Aptigon Capital.

elements.title: Litigation involving patent and intellectual property rights

data.value: Substantial litigation involving patent and other intellectual property rights in the biotechnology and biopharmaceutical industries.
Claims can divert management's attention, are expensive and time-consuming to litigate.
Court may impose substantial monetary damages for past infringement.
Court may prohibit selling or licensing products pending license agreements.
Uncertainty about the strength and enforceability of patents.
Competitors may develop similar products not restricted by existing patents.

Anticipated NDA for Gencaro includes efficacy claims based on receptor genotype.
Potential challenges in protecting intellectual property rights in foreign jurisdictions.

elements.title: Expense Breakdown as of December 31, 2022 and 2021 (in millions)

data.value: The Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors oversees the Company’s compensation strategy, policies, and programs.
The Compensation Committee reviews performance and advancement potential of senior management and succession plans.
The Committee is responsible for approving performance-based compensation plans and executive compensation programs.
Prepares and approves the Report of the Compensation Committee for the annual meeting proxy statement.
The Committee meets as deemed appropriate, with agendas developed by the Chair.
The Committee has authority to retain consultants for evaluating executive compensation.
Executive compensation is set to align with peer companies and to incentivize corporate goal achievement.
Reviewed changes to the ARCA 2013 Equity Incentive Plan, leading to the approval of the 2020 ARCA Equity Incentive Plan.
Michael R. Bristow: $345,000 base salary, 50% target bonus; Thomas A. Keuer: $340,000 base salary, 40% target bonus; Christopher D. Ozeroff: $304,000 base salary, 35% target bonus.
Determines compensation levels, bonus and equity awards, and establishes performance objectives.
Compensation considerations are reviewed primarily in the first quarter, with ongoing evaluations throughout the year.
Compensation is evaluated based on Company and individual goals.
91% of stockholders approved executive compensation at the 2022 annual meeting.

elements.title: Gencaro Clinical Development and Regulatory Strategy

data.value: Gencaro reduced the primary endpoint of mortality or heart transplantation by 43%.
Enhanced efficacy in beta-1 389 arginine homozygous genotype.
Phase 3 clinical trial planned with a focus on HF patients with AF, targeting specific genotypes.
Obtain initial approval for AF treatment in specific HF population (EF ≥ 40%).
Clinical trial is based on an SPA agreement with the FDA.
NDA submission eligible for expedited review under Fast Track program.
First cardiovascular drug integrated with a companion diagnostic test.

elements.title: Development Pipeline and Financial Resources for Gencaro

data.value: Gencaro™ (bucindolol hydrochloride)
Atrial fibrillation in patients with chronic heart failure
A pharmacogenetic-targeted beta-adrenergic receptor antagonist with mild vasodilator properties.
Obtain initial approval for Gencaro to treat AF in HF patients with EF between 40% and 55%.
Additional indication expansion opportunities for other AF populations.
Additional financing for clinical trials and operational costs.
Risk of inability to raise capital and potential discontinuation of development activities.
Entered into a sales agreement to sell common stock for up to $54 million.
$4.7 million
$13.8 million

elements.title: Risks Related to Product Candidates and Clinical Trials

data.value: Failure to demonstrate safety and efficacy of product candidates Gencaro or rNAPc2.
Adverse effects on business, inability to complete transactions, or obtain financing.
Marketing approval required from regulatory authorities.
Need for capital resources and management expertise to commercialize products.
Potential difficulties in enrolling patients for clinical trials.
Delay or termination of trials affecting approval timelines.
Uncertainty in achieving marketable products from trials.
Possible undesirable side effects halting clinical trials.
Delays in achieving projected goals for clinical trials and regulatory approvals.
Material adverse effects on business results due to milestone failures.

elements.title: Future sales and market acceptance of Gencaro

data.value: Future sales of Gencaro may suffer if its marketplace acceptance is negatively affected by the genetic test.
The genetic test is an important component of the commercial strategy for Gencaro.
Gencaro aims to compete effectively with current therapies.
Gencaro has not received an NDA approval from the FDA.
The FDA requires additional clinical trials to approve Gencaro.
The company expects to continue incurring significant operating losses for the foreseeable future.
Years away from commercializing and generating product revenue.
Company is navigating complex regulatory processes for new drug approval.
A Phase 2B clinical study was completed with 267 HF patients.
NDA filed in 2008, accepted by FDA. Complete Response Letter received in 2009.

elements.title: Risks Related to Strategic Evaluation Process and Business

data.value: If Gencaro or rNAPc2 are approved by the FDA, they may not succeed in a competitive marketplace.
We may be unable to expand our business if we fail to identify and license or acquire other products or product candidates.
The loss of rights to market key products would significantly impair our operating results.
Third parties may own or control patents necessary for commercialization, which could lead to costly litigation.
Our intellectual property rights may not prevent competitors from developing similar products.
Even if we engage in a strategic transaction, it may not increase stockholder value.

data.key: Special Committee for evaluating strategic options
data.value: In April 2022, a Special Committee was established to evaluate strategic options.
Strategic transactions may incur non-recurring charges and pose integration challenges.
Acquisitions may require issuance of dilutive equity or substantial debt, impacting operations.

elements.title: Concerns Regarding Delisting from Nasdaq and Going Concern

data.value: Potential delisting from the Nasdaq Capital Market due to failure to maintain listing requirements.
Received three potential delisting notices from Nasdaq in 2012, 2015, and 2018 due to minimum closing bid price violations.
1-for-6 reverse split in March 2013, 1-for-7 in September 2015, and 1-for-18 in April 2019 to regain compliance.
As of February 22, 2023, common stock price was $2.12.

Gencaro™ (bucindolol hydrochloride) for the treatment of atrial fibrillation in patients with heart failure.

Issued a US patent in February 2021 for Gencaro which extends protection until 2039.

data.key: Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures
data.value: Under the supervision and with the participation of management, including our Principal Executive Officer and Principal Financial Officer, we have evaluated the effectiveness of the design and operation of our disclosure controls and procedures.
Our Principal Executive Officer and Principal Financial Officer concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were effective as of the end of the period covered by this annual report.
Management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal controls over financial reporting.
We assessed the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2022, using criteria from the COSO report.
We concluded our internal control over financial reporting was effective as of December 31, 2022.
Management’s report was not subject to attestation by our independent registered public accounting firm.
During the fourth quarter of 2022, there were no changes in our internal control over financial reporting that materially affected or are likely to materially affect our internal control.
Management does not expect that our disclosure controls and procedures will prevent all errors and all fraud.

elements.title: FDA Regulatory Approvals for Drug Commercialization

data.value: If the FDA approves the NDA, the sponsor is authorized to begin commercialization of the drug in accordance with the approval.
The FDA may decide later to suspend or withdraw product approval if compliance with regulatory standards is not maintained.
Post-marketing, the FDA requires surveillance programs to monitor approved products.
Products are subject to periodic inspection and continued regulation by regulatory authorities.
The Drug Price Competition and Patent Term Restoration Act of 1984 established an abbreviated FDA review process for generic drugs.
Approval for a generic drug is obtained by filing an abbreviated NDA or ANDA.
U.S. patents covering subjects requiring regulatory approval may obtain a patent term extension.
The FDA regularly inspects companies to ensure compliance with cGMP and post-market requirements.
If significant changes are made to a device, its manufacturing or labeling, a PMA supplement containing additional information must be filed for prior FDA approval.
PMA supplements often must be approved by the FDA before the modification to the device, the labeling, or manufacturing process may be implemented.
Delays in receipt of or failure to receive such clearances or approvals could have a material adverse effect on business, financial condition, and results of operations.
Clinical trials are generally required to support a PMA application and may be required for 510(k) clearance.
An Investigational Device Exemption (IDE) application must be approved in advance by the FDA for clinical trials.
Proposed studies deemed as non-significant risk studies may qualify for exemption from IDE requirements.
The trial must comply with FDA’s regulations, including obtaining informed consent from each subject before conducting trials.
IVD companion diagnostic devices provide essential information for the safe use of corresponding therapeutic products.
The FDA's regulation of IVD companion diagnostic devices is evolving and implemented on a case-by-case basis.
International sales are subject to foreign government regulations which vary substantially and are subject to change.
Annual reports on Form 10-K, quarterly reports on Form 10-Q and current reports on Form 8-K.

http://www.sec.gov

The possibility of condition for approval requiring further clinical trials which may affect financial resources.

elements.title: Risks Inherent in Drug Development and Regulatory Approval Process

data.value: All of our product candidates are prone to the risks of failure inherent in drug development.
The results from preclinical animal testing and early human clinical trials may not be predictive of results obtained in later human clinical trials.
Although a new product may show promising results, it may prove impossible to generate sufficient data for regulatory approvals.
Data from studies are susceptible to varying interpretations that may delay regulatory approval.
The FDA and other regulatory authorities exercise substantial discretion in the approval process.
The FDA can delay or deny approval for safety, efficacy, design defects, and regulation changes.
Increased media attention has raised concerns about drug safety issues affecting approval processes.
If approved, we face ongoing regulatory obligations that may limit our ability to commercialize products.
Manufacturing facilities must conform to cGMP standards after approval.
Unknown issues may lead to additional control or withdrawal of products.

Failure to comply with data protection laws and regulations could lead to government enforcement actions, litigation, and adverse publicity, negatively affecting operating results.
Numerous federal and state laws govern the collection and protection of personal information.
Health information subject to privacy requirements under HIPAA.
California Consumer Privacy Act gives rights to California residents concerning their personal information.
General Data Protection Regulation imposes strict obligations regarding personal data of EU subjects.
GDPR violations can result in fines up to 20 million Euros or 4% of worldwide turnover.
Compliance with privacy laws may restrict data collection and usage, increasing costs and liabilities.

elements.title: Gencaro Patent and Non-Patent Marketing Exclusivity Information

data.value: The patent owner submits an application for PTE that includes all necessary supporting information within 60 days of FDA approval; drug application is for the first permitted commercial marketing.
If Gencaro is approved, patents may be eligible for SPC providing up to five years of additional patent life.
Provides five years of marketing exclusivity to the first applicant for drugs that contain a new chemical entity.
An ANDA or 505(b)(2) NDA cannot be submitted until the exclusivity period ends, preventing competition until then.
Three years exclusivity provided for new clinical investigations essential to FDA approval.
If approved in the EU, Gencaro may be eligible for ten years of market exclusivity.
